meanings.definition: A large, stable block of the earth's crust forming the nucleus of a continent.
meanings.sent1: The cratons beneath the continent provide a strong foundation.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study cratons to understand the structure of continents.
meanings.sent3: The cratons decided to throw a party deep underground.
meanings.sent4: Her wisdom was as unyielding as the cratons beneath our feet.
meanings.sent5: The cratons stood still, like ancient guardians of the land.

meanings.definition: The oldest and most stable part of a continent.
meanings.sent1: Exploring the cratons reveals the continent's history.
meanings.sent2: The cratons have remained unchanged for millions of years.
meanings.sent3: The cratons hosted a rock concert for the younger rocks.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was as enduring as the cratons of the continent.
meanings.sent5: The cratons whispered tales of ancient times to the winds.
